thread.title: Time Warner, Verizon customers in Triangle hit by outage
thread.title_full: Time Warner, Verizon customers in Triangle hit by outage

author: The Associated Press
title: Time Warner, Verizon customers in Triangle hit by outage
text:
Time Warner, Verizon customers in Triangle hit by outage The Associated Press Order Reprint of this Story RALEIGH, N.C. 
Thousands of Time Warner and Verizon customers have lost their phone and internet service in the Research Triangle area. 
Local media outlets report Verizon said the outage was limited to phone calls on its network in Durham, Wake and Orange counties, but users in Johnston, Lee, Nash and Wilson counties also said they had no phone service. 
While some users were able to send text messages by phone, others reported they had lost that service as well. 
The cause of the outage is unknown. 
Local law enforcement agencies reminded Verizon customers that because of the outage, they would not be able to call 911 from their cellphones. Many counties now offer the ability to text in an emergency. 
A Time Warner spokesman didn't immediately respond to a message seeking comment. Related content
